intro: Wormskioldia tanacetifolia, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow composite flowers that resemble those of the dandelion. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Wormskioldia tanacetifolia is also known for its medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
